Devlin bails him out, hoping he will return to safe-cracking, but Gerry leaves town and becomes a typesetter for a Western newspaper. Movies.description: Alice has two persistent suitors, one rich, one poor. Each buys her an engagement ring; the rich man pays cash, but the poor man must pay on installments.�

Movies.description: Fred Ward and Mack Sennett are two Spanish brothers seeking the hand of a lovely senorita played by Mabel Normand. They provide some simple amusement in this pleasant little ditty.

Movies.description: A send-up of Griffith's THE LONELY VILLA and other movies of that sort, such as THE GIRLS AND DADDY, THE LONEDALE OPERATOR and many others, as the heroine, thinking that burglars are trying to break into her home phones her husband at the office, who rushes home.

Movies.description: Mabel Normand is the wife of a rather rotund businessman, Dell Henderson. She doesn't get along with her mother Kate Bruce. She steals some money from her hubby to go shopping.�

Movies.title: When Kings Were the Law
Movies.description: Over the Kingdom of Romanda there reigned a King who was greatly influenced by his favorite, whom he devotedly loved

Movies.title: Helen's Marriage
Movies.description: The movie begins with Tom carrying a ladder for an elopement with Helen.

Movies.title: The Tourists
Movies.description: A group of tourists spend too long checking out the Indian Arts and Crafts at the station and miss their train.�

Movies.title: The Tragedy of a Dress Suit
Movies.description: A Mack Sennett comedy short starring Dell Henderson & Mabel Normand.

Movies.title: An Interrupted Elopement

Movies.description: Harry expected to come in for a portion of his uncle's estate, but didn't figure that he would get his share before his worthy relative's demise.

Movies.title: The Water Nymph
Movies.description: Mabel and her sweetheart go to the beach and play a trick on the boyfriend's father.

Movies.description: A Misplaced Foot is a 1914 movie starring Mabel Normand and Roscoe Arbuckle.

Movies.description: Working as a manicurist at the Ritz, Helen Thurston, is in love with her wealthy patron, Jack Standring, but the young man's mother wants him to marry a rich debutante.

Movies.title: Toton
Movies.description: In David's absence, his father hires a lawyer to convince Yvonne that David has abandoned her, and grief-stricken, she dies soon after her little girl is born.

Movies.title: The Follies Girl
Movies.description: The relatives of dying Edward Woodruff, Nina Leffingwell, her brother Frederic, and her cousin Basil, whom she wants to marry, scheme to inherit Woodruff's wealth.�

Movies.title: Love's Prisoner
Movies.description: A young lady, who "hates the law" rises from the tenements to society. Financial reverses lead her to commit a series of burglaries as "The Bird".�

Movies.title: Upstairs and Down
Movies.description: Alice Chesterton is described as a "Baby Vamp" by the social set and engaged to boring Tom Carey.

Movies.title: Prudence on Broadway
Movies.description: Prudence's ( Olive Thomas ) parents send her from their Pennsylvania Quaker colony to a fashionable girls seminary, hoping she can learn about the devil's tricks, instead she engages in girlish pranks, but uses her pure appearance to escape blame.�

Movies.title: The Spite Bride
Movies.description: Tessa Doyle, an innocent country girl who has come to New York and joined a vaudeville sister act, becomes embroiled in a scheme to earn money at her partner Trixie Dennis' insistence.

Movies.title: The Glorious Lady
Movies.description: During an annual celebration in which English peasants and aristocrats mingle, the Duke of Loame is thrown from his horse and saved by Ivis Benson, the daughter of a tenant farmer.

Movies.title: Out Yonder
Movies.description: Flotsam (Thomas) is the daughter and helper of crusty old lighthouse keeper Joe Clark (Edward Ellis, in fine form). The reason why Clark lives 'out yonder' is because he's a fugitive from justice: years ago, he killed a man under complicated circumstances.

Movies.title: Footlights and Shadows
Movies.description: A fortune-hunting follies star Gloria Dawn ( Olive Thomas ), begins to question her engagement to wealthy Peter Shaw after meeting an amnesiac young man who stumbles into her apartment one night.�

Movies.title: Youthful Folly
Movies.description: Nancy is a restless young girl tired of living on a plantation with her three old-maid aunts. Her life brightens when her cousin Lola comes visiting from New York.

Movies.title: The Flapper
Movies.description: A Southern teen at a ritzy boarding school gets into mischief while acting the sophisticated grownup to impress a suave gentleman and match wits with a pair of jewel thieves.

Movies.title: Darling Mine
Movies.description: Persuaded by a letter from her Aunt Agnes in America, Kitty McCarthy ( Olive Thomas ) travels from Ireland to New York City, there she meets Gordon Davis, a successful playwright, who directs her to her aunt's address on the East Side.�

Movies.title: Everybody's Sweetheart
Movies.description: When the benign headmistress of the county poor farm is discharged and replaced with a tyrant, John and Mary, two orphans who have lived there since infancy, decide to run away.

Movies.title: One a Minute
Movies.description: An excellent silent comedy starring unjustly forgotten star Douglas MacLean.�

Movies.title: Camille
Movies.description: Camille is a courtesan in Paris. She falls deeply in love with a young man of promise, Armand Duval. When Armand's father begs her not to ruin his hope of a career and position by marrying Armand, she acquiesces and leaves her lover.

Movies.title: Handle with Care
Movies.description: Two years later, David, absorbed in an important lawsuit, forgets their wedding anniversary, and when reprimanded for his neglect, he agrees to give Jeanne a divorce if any one of her ex-suitors will elope with her.�

Movies.title: Where's My Wandering Boy Tonight?
Movies.description: Garry Beecher, forgetting his mother and sweetheart, Lorna, falls in love with Veronica, a chorus girl, and heads for the city; finding her with a millionaire, he returns home and robs his former employer, then returns to Veronica and begins a career of reckless spending.�

Movies.title: Watch Your Step
Movies.description: A spoiled young man from a rich family likes to race his car through town and then try to outrun the police who chase him, although he's usually caught. After his latest incident his father warns him to cease and desist, and the man promises to reform.

Movies.title: The Wampas Baby Stars of 1922
Movies.description: The WAMPAS Baby Stars was a promotional campaign sponsored by the United States Western Association of Motion Picture Advertisers, which honored 13 (15 in 1932) young actresses each year whom they believed to be on the threshold of movie stardom. 1922 was the first.

Movies.title: The Fighting Streak
Movies.description: Andy Lanning, a peace-loving blacksmith, rescues Ann, the fianc�e of Charles Merchant, from a runaway team.�

Movies.title: For Big Stakes
Movies.description: "Clean-Up" Sudden is a drifter restoring law and order to a small farming community run by a corrupt sheriff in this silent Western.

Movies.title: Trimmed
Movies.description: Returning from service in the A. E. F., Dale Garland is given a rousing reception by his townsmen.

Movies.title: Remembrance
Movies.description: Although he graduated from that time-worn university, the college of hard knocks, the tireless efforts of John P. Grout have paid off. He owns a number of department stores and his wife and children are well provided for.�

Movies.title: Omar the Tentmaker
Movies.description: The student Omar loves and secretly marries Shireen, but she is taken away by the Shah of Shahs to join his household. For spurning the shah, Shireen is thrown into a dungeon, then sold into slavery when her child is born.

Movies.title: The Girl I Loved
Movies.description: John Middleton is distressed to learn that his family is taking in an orphan girl named Mary. He turns aside all her attempts to befriend him. But with the passage of time, John discovers (long after everyone else has) that he loves Mary.

Movies.title: Souls for Sale
Movies.description: A young woman hits Hollywood, determined to become a star.

Movies.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
Movies.description: In 15th century France, a gypsy girl is framed for murder by the infatuated Chief Justice, and only the deformed bellringer of Notre Dame Cathedral can save her.

Movies.title: Name the Man
Movies.description: Victor Stowell, son of the deemster of the Isle of Man, is engaged to Fenella Stanley. He becomes involved in an intrigue with local girl Bessie Collister, becomes the deemster on his father's death, and is forced to try Bessie for killing her illegitimate child.

Movies.title: The Yankee Consul
Movies.description: A whale of a comedy thriller. It's a Niagra of roaring laughter Faster Than the Wind!

Movies.title: Singer Jim Mckee
Movies.description: Jim McKee and his friend Buck rob a stagecoach to get money to support Buck's daughter. Buck is killed, but Jim and the daughter escape. Fifteen years later, Jim finds that he must turn robber again to continue to provide for Buck's daughter.

Movies.title: The Breaking Point
Movies.description: Assuming that he has killed the husband of the woman he also loves, Judson Clark flees through a blizzard to a lonely cabin, where he nearly dies.

Movies.description: In spite of Angelique Dean's seeming friendship for Chapman Griswold, a society bum, John Dawson falls in love with her and asks the charming and mysterious "widow" to marry him. John then learns from Griswold that Angelique has never been married.

Movies.title: Head Winds
Movies.description: Peter kidnaps Patricia to prevent her from marrying the wrong man.

Movies.description: A ship carrying a touring circus troupe sinks at sea, and Lorraine, a young girl, is washed up on a deserted island. Her only companion is a gorilla from the circus, Bimi, who raises her as its own.

Movies.title: Red Hot Tires
Movies.description: The first time Al Jones sees Elizabeth Lowden, he becomes so distracted that he runs his car into a steamroller. The second time he sees her, Elizabeth's car frightens his horse, causing him to fall.

Movies.title: Rose of the World
Movies.description: After a time, she marries Sir Arthur Gerardine but is unable to forget her first husband, and gradually her love for him is rekindled, especially when she contrasts him to the pompous and elderly Sir Arthur.

Movies.description: Lefty O'Brien, a pugilist, becomes engaged to ex-tomboy Patsy Ryan against the wishes of her father, Michael. They both live in an Irish-Jewish neighborhood on New York's East Side known as "Hogan's Alley."

Movies.title: Camille: The Fate of a Coquette
Movies.description: �A home movie version of the Dumas play. A young woman becomes a courtesan and tragedy befalls her.�

Movies.title: The Fighting Edge
Movies.description: Juan de Dios O'Rourke (Kenneth Harlan), an American Secret Service, of Spanish-Irish descent, leads the cattle ranchers and border patrol in a fight to suppress a gang of cattle rustlers, who have been driving large herds north-to-south from Texas into Mexico, and smuggling illegal, no-passport Chinese aliens.

Movies.title: The King of the Turf
Movies.description: Genteel southern horse-breeder Col. Richard Fairfax is framed on the charge of embezzlement by Martyn Selsby, his business partner, and sentenced to jail.�

Movies.title: Why Girls Go Back Home
Movies.description: Trusting country girl Marie Downey falls in love with touring stage-actor Clifford Dudley. As he becomes a matinee idol on Broadway, she turns a chorus girl.

Movies.title: Oh! What a Nurse!
Movies.description: Oh! What a Nurse! is a 1926 American comedy film directed by Charles Reisner and written by Darryl F. Zanuck. The film stars Sydney Chaplin, Patsy Ruth Miller, Gayne Whitman, Matthew Betz, Edith Yorke, and David Torrence.�

Movies.title: Hell-Bent for Heaven
Movies.description: Sid Hunt and Jude Lowery are Carolina sweethearts but hired-hand Rufe Pryer also has his eyes on her.�

Movies.title: So This Is Paris
Movies.description: Paul and Suzanne Giraud are happily married and living in a quiet neighborhood. When Suzanne notices that their new neighbors are expressive dancers in revealing outfits, she demands Paul speak to them about their lack of morality.�

Movies.title: Broken Hearts of Hollywood
Movies.description: Virginia Perry, a former movie star, leaves her family and returns to Hollywood to make a comeback, but age has taken its toll and she is cast in small character roles. Meanwhile, her daughter, Betty Ann, has won a beauty contest, and heads for Hollywood.

Movies.title: The First Auto
Movies.description: Hank owns horses, stables horses and races horses. He favorite horse always wins and he is prosperous and well known. His son (Bob), however, dreams only of the future of the horseless carriage and not of the horse.

Movies.title: Painting the Town
Movies.description: Misinterpreting her fluttering eyelashes as a sign of true and lasting love, Hector follows Patsy to New York, much to the dismay of the girl's wealthy fiance.

Movies.title: Once and Forever
Movies.description: Silent romantic drama starring Patsy Ruth Miller who suffers along with her beloved after he loses his sight during WWI.

Movies.title: South Sea Love
Movies.description: White men grown brutish from jungle life---a beautiful girl at their mercy---risking all for love!

Movies.title: A Hero for a Night
Movies.description: Cab driver falls for rich model.

Movies.title: The Circus: Premiere
Movies.description: Footage from the premiere of Charlie Chaplin's 1928 film 'The Circus'.

Movies.title: The Tragedy of Youth
Movies.description: Neglected by shallow husband Dick, young bride Paula Wayne seeks male companionship outside the marital nest. She soon finds it in the form of mature lover Frank Gordon.

Movies.title: Red Riders of Canada
Movies.description: Mountie does battle with half-breed trappers.

Movies.title: We Americans
Movies.description: Sloman concentrates on the trials and tribulations of three first-generation American families: The Jewish Levines, the German Schmidts and the Italian Albertinis.

Movies.title: Fashion News
Movies.description: Hollywood actresses including Jeanette Loff and Raquel Torres modeling Spring fashions in color.

Movies.title: Tropical Nights
Movies.description: Patsy Ruth Miller stars as the romantic bone of contention between pearl divers Malcolm McGregor and Wallace MacDonald. When McGregor's brother is murdered, Miller is arrested for the crime.

Movies.title: The Fall of Eve
Movies.description: Tom Ford, Jr., keeps secret his romance with his father's secretary, Eve Grant. Ford, Sr., enlists Eve to entertain out-of-town buyer Mr. Mack.

Movies.title: Twin Beds
Movies.description: A young husband just wants to spend a quiet evening at home with his wife, but her collection of zany friends make hash of his hopes.

Movies.title: The Hottentot
Movies.description: The Hottentot is a lost 1929 American pre-Code film directed by Roy Del Ruth and starring Edward Everett Horton and Patsy Ruth Miller. It is based on a 1920 Broadway play, The Hottentot, by William Collier, Sr. and Victor Mapes.

Movies.title: So Long Letty
Movies.description: At the hotel, with his two granddaughters Ruth and Sally, Uncle Claude meets a wise talking employee named Letty, which causes him to leave the hotel.�

Movies.title: The Sap
Movies.description: �A small town dimwit takes the blame for his brother-in-law's crime.

Movies.title: Show of Shows
Movies.description: In 1929, the studio gave the cinema its voice and offered audiences a chance to hear their favorite actors and actresses from the silent-screen era. For the first time, they can be heard in a gaudy, grandiose musical-comedy revue.

Movies.title: The Aviator
Movies.description: Misadventures of a bogus flyer.

Movies.title: Wide Open
Movies.description: An eccentric, fluttery bachelor is dismayed to discover an undressed woman in his apartment.

Movies.title: The Last of the Lone Wolf
Movies.description: In this entry in the Lone Wolf series, the first to have a soundtrack, the jealousies of the King and the coquettish Queen are chronicled.�

Movies.title: Lonely Wives
Movies.description: A highly respectable lawyer becomes a sexual animal after working hours; His live-in mother-in-law tries to keep him in line. When an actor-impersonator comes to see him, the two switch lives.

Movies.title: The Great Junction Hotel
Movies.description: A Masquers' Club spoof short. Newly-weds spend their wedding night in a run-down hotel, watched over by an under-employed house detective. When the bride goes missing, the groom (Horton) is chief suspect number one.�

Movies.title: Night Beat
Movies.description: A young couple finds themselves mixed up with mobsters planning to rob a warehouse.

Movies.title: Quebec
Movies.description: Story of a revolt against England in 1830s Canada.

Movies.title: Lon Chaney: Behind the Mask
Movies.description: A documentary on the life and career of actor Lon Chaney, with clips from his films and interviews with people who knew him.

Movies.title: Lon Chaney: A Thousand Faces
Movies.description: Lon Chaney, the silent movie star and makeup artist, renowned for his various characterizations and celebrated for his horror films, becomes the subject of this documentary.

Movies.title: The Eternal City
Movies.description: Leone, a Papal guard, is devastated when his wife drowns herself after mistakenly thinking that he had abandoned her. He turns over his son David to be brought up by nuns, then enters a monastery.�

Movies.title: Sold
Movies.description: A successful artist and a struggling one both love the same woman; she chooses the poor one but as the years roll on and other choices she makes and her husband�s misunderstanding lead to a near breaking point for the couple.

Movies.title: Zaza
Movies.description: Zaza is a music hall star in Paris. She meets Bernard Dufrene and a flirtation develops into an intense love on her part. She is in despair when she discovers that he already has a wife and child.�

Movies.title: Bella Donna
Movies.description: Bella Donna ( Pauline Frederick ) a seductive woman snares Nigel Armine ( Thomas Holding ) into marriage and he takes her to Egypt to live. Tired of her simple husband, Bella becomes involved with brutish Baroudi.

Movies.title: The Spider
Movies.description: Valerie St. Cyr, seizes a chance for excitement and money, deserts her infant daughter Joan and her impoverished husband and runs away to Paris with the Count Du Poissy.�

Movies.title: The Moment Before
Movies.description: The film begins by presenting the elderly and elegant Duke and Duchess of Maldon, engaged in charitable acts in a Dickensian village. The following day, the duke falls off his horse and is mortally injured.�

Movies.title: Sapho
Movies.description: The classic story of a flower girl from the slums who becomes Sapho.

Movies.title: Her Better Self
Movies.description: Even though society debutante Vivian Tyler (Pauline Frederick) is engaged to Count Belloto (Frank deRheim), she finds herself attracted to Dr. Robert Keith (Thomas Meighan).�

Movies.title: The Love That Lives
Movies.description: When her husband Pete is shot over a craps game, Molly McGill goes to work as a scrubwoman to support her two children.

Movies.title: Mrs. Dane's Defense
Movies.description: An Englishwoman misbehaves in Canada, driving a traveling companion to suicide and bearing a secret child whom she whisks away.�

Movies.title: Stake Uncle Sam to Play Your Hand
Movies.description: The Kaiser is playing cards with King Albert of Italy, who loses, but is rescued by Miss Liberty Loan.

Movies.title: Out of the Shadow
Movies.description: Ruth Minchin is unhappily married to her father's former business partner, a drunken brute.�

Movies.title: The Woman on the Index
Movies.description: Sylvia Martin is a destitute young woman who is taken home by Louis Gordon. She doesn't realize he's the leader of a gang of crooks until after she marries him.

Movies.title: Paid in Full
Movies.description: A bookkeeper's embezzling scheme is discovered by his wife, while his boss's romantic feelings for her complicate matters further.

Movies.title: Bonds of Love
Movies.description: A young woman is hired as a governess for the son of a man grieving the loss of his wife. The governess's presence is unwelcome to the rest of the family, especially after the governess develops a romantic attachment to her employer.

Movies.title: The Loves of Letty
Movies.description: Letty Shell, a clerk in a London brokerage office, is discouraged by her lack of fine clothes and social position.�

Movies.title: The Paliser Case
Movies.description: A young woman consents to a bad marriage to an unscrupulous man in order to save her father from ruin. When her marriage is disrupted by a murder, three different people confess to it.

Movies.title: The Woman in Room 13
Movies.description: Laura Bruce is married to John Bruce, police commissioner. She discovers her husband is enjoying a drunken revel with another woman, and vows she will obtain a divorce. After doing so she weds Paul Ramsey.

Movies.title: Madame X
Movies.description: Jacqueline Floriot is driven from her home by her husband Louis, a deputy attorney of Paris, because of his unjust suspicions regarding her relations with another man.

Movies.title: The Mistress of Shenstone
Movies.description: The husband of Lady Myra Ingleby is off fighting in the World War. She is devastated when Sir Derysk Brand tells her that her husband has been killed.

Movies.title: The Lure of Jade
Movies.description: Rear Admiral Vincent's daughter Sara, has a passion for collecting jade, was previously been in love with Captain Corey, but she insisted that he marry his fiancee, Alida, who remains intensely jealous of Sara.

Movies.title: Screen Snapshots, Series 3, No. 12
Movies.description: Another entry in the popular one-reel series.

Movies.title: Three Women
Movies.description: A frivolous middle aged socialite is suddenly put upon to have her daughter live with her. Her conniving paramour dumps her for the daughter, leaving the young boyfriend crushed.

Movies.title: Married Flirts
Movies.description: Jill Wetherell, who is looking for a rich husband, finds Wayne to be easy prey and Nelly catches them together. She divorces Wayne and travels to Europe.

Movies.title: Smouldering Fires
Movies.description: A successful businesswoman falls in love with one of her much younger factory workers.

Movies.title: Her Honor, the Governor
Movies.description: The only son of Gov. Adele Fenway, Bob, is engaged to Marian Lee, and at a dinner Adele announces her intention of giving them a wedding house. Having refused to support a water power bill endorsed by Jim Dornton, the political boss of the state, the governor is threatened.

Movies.title: Devil's Island
Movies.description: A wealthy Parisian surgeon finds himself serving time in a brutal penal colony.

Movies.title: Josselyn's Wife
Movies.description: Only six months of marital bliss and Lillian Josselyn is filled with dread at the return of Pierre Marchand, her former lover, who left her to marry Ellen Latimer.

Movies.title: Mumsie
Movies.description: A pacifist gambler turns spy and gives his father's gas factory plans to the enemy.

Movies.title: On Trial
Movies.description: A man is put on trial for the murder of his best friend. A young attorney wants to become successful and decides to defend him. However, he is very inexperienced.

Movies.title: The Sacred Flame
Movies.description: Colonel Maurice Taylor of the Royal Flying Corps is hopelessly injured in an airplane crash immediately following his marriage to Stella.�

Movies.title: Evidence
Movies.description: Lord Cyril Wimborne, a barrister, divorces his wife, Myra, and takes custody of their child, Kenyon, when he finds her name linked with the profligate Major Pollock. Myra goes into seclusion while Pollock, intending to conceal Myra's innocence, goes to Burma.�

Movies.title: Terra Melophon Magazin Nr. 1
Movies.description: Various topics, e.g. reading from the book "Ich lasse Dich nicht"; explanation of how a telephone conversation between Berlin and New York works; making a martini; sports teacher Siegfried Dietrich on gymnastic exercises; a sketch; a pop song; revue girls. Maria Ney hosts the program.

Movies.title: This Modern Age
Movies.description: A Harvard football star disobeys his upper class parents and runs off with his true love.

Movies.title: Wayward
Movies.description: Story of a mother's antagonism to her son's wife. Based on the novel "Wild Beauty" by Mateel Howe Farnham.

Movies.title: The Phantom of Crestwood
Movies.description: Five men have to prove their innocence when a blackmailer is murdered.

Movies.title: Self Defense
Movies.description: Katy Devoux runs a gambling-drinking joint in British Columbia. She is a fair-playing business woman, but is ashamed of the source of her income, so she has had her daughter Nona raised in the states.

Movies.title: Social Register
Movies.description: Chorus girl Patsy Shaw crashes a high-society party, meets playboy Charlie Breen, they fall in love, and are on their merry way to wedded bliss. However, Charlie's snobbish, ever-loving mama doesn't think that Patsy is worthy and sets out to prove it.

Movies.title: My Marriage
Movies.description: When gangster's bullets put an end to the career of H.J. Barton, underworld gambling czar who masquerades as a respectable member of high society, his daughter Carol is left to bear the brunt of social stigma. Barney Dolan, a policeman friend of Barton, pledges to aid Carol in finding the killers of her father.

Movies.title: Ramona
Movies.description: Half-Indian girl brought up in a wealthy household is loved by the son of the house against his family�s wishes and loves another Indian employed by the household.�

Movies.title: Thank You, Mr. Moto
Movies.description: Mr. Moto Heads to China on a quest for seven ancient scrolls that reveal the location of Genghis Khan's tomb�a crypt filled with fabulous treasure! But Moto isn't the only one stalking the scrolls�so is a shadowy band of thieves.

Movies.title: Intolerance: Love's Struggle Throughout the Ages
Movies.description: The story of a poor young woman, separated by prejudice from her husband and baby, is interwoven with tales of intolerance from throughout history.

Movies.title: Puppets
Movies.description: A modern story of Commedia dell'Arte's Pierrot and Columbine.

Movies.title: Cheerful Givers
Movies.description: Judy's family takes in seven orphans after the orphanage is foreclosed on by a hard-hearted businesswoman.

Movies.title: Madame Bo-Peep
Movies.description: A 1917 filmd riected by Chester Withey.

Movies.title: Until They Get Me
Movies.description: In an effort to reach his wife's deathbed, Kirby is forced to kill a man in self-defense. He is arrested by Selwyn, a member of the North West Mounted Police, who allows him to say a last farewell to his wife.

Movies.title: Daughter Angele
Movies.description: Her daughter, Angele, disguises herself as a Belgian war refugee and her grandfather--not knowing who she really is--takes her into his house and, eventually, into his heart.

Movies.title: The Atom
Movies.description: Jennie is a slavey in a theatrical boarding house. To her the actors are all wonderful, but Montague Booth is the chief. In an accident Booth is disfigured for life and is saved from suicide by Jennie.�

Movies.title: Irish Eyes
Movies.description: When her father is killed during a drunken brawl, a stunned Pegeen wanders down to the shore in her grief. She is noticed by Sir Arthur Ormsby, an Englishman who just happens to be sailing his yacht up the coast.�

Movies.title: Whom the Gods Would Destroy
Movies.description: After a young inventor discovers a powerful new explosive, agents from a German chemical firm induce him to study at a German university. While there, he is repelled by certain aspects of the people, and he leaves for Belgium.

Movies.title: The Life Line
Movies.description: Jack Hearne, known as the Romany Rye, prefers living with the gypsies rather than claiming the right to his part of his half brother Phillip Royston's country estate, Cragsnest.�

Movies.title: The Broken Butterfly
Movies.description: Before she parts from him for a while, a woman falls in love with a composer, working on a symphony, who she encounters in the forests of Canada.

Movies.title: Soldiers of Fortune
Movies.description: Civil engineer Robert Clay is commissioned by wealthy New Yorker Mr. Langham to open iron deposits in the tiny South American republic of Olancho.�

Movies.title: Eyes of Youth
Movies.description: A young woman, confronted by four options for proceeding in her life, is granted the ability to see what results would come from her choice of of the options. After she sees her future along three of the roads, she makes her choice.

Movies.title: The Little Shepherd of Kingdom Come
Movies.description: An orphan boy from the Kentucky hills joins the Union Army and rescues his adopted family from Morgan's raiders. He learns his real identity when he returns after the war.

Movies.title: Dangerous Days
Movies.description: Patriotism, love and treason in the United States during the First World War. Barker manages to give every scene the right climate through inventive use of color.�

Movies.title: The Courage of Marge O'Doone
Movies.description: Michael O'Doone, his wife Margaret and daughter Marge are settlers living in the Northwest. One winter day, while on a journey, Michael meets with an accident and fails to return home.�

Movies.title: Seeds of Vengeance
Movies.description: In the mountains of West Virginia, Alderson Cree is mortally wounded in an ambush by Kip Ryerson, after Kip's wife, Martha, seeks refuge at the Crees's home for herself and her stepdaughter, Eileen.

Movies.title: The Untamed
Movies.description: A cowpuncher by the name of Whistling Dan is adopted by a rancher, Joe Cumberland (James O. Barrows). His daughter, Kate is immediately attracted to Dan, but Cumberland discourages the union since he thinks the young man is too wild for her.

Movies.title: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court
Movies.description: In 1921, a young man, having read Mark Twain's classic novel of the same title, dreams that he himself travels to King Arthur's court, where he has similar adventures and outwits his foes by means of very modern inventions including motorcycles and nitroglycerine.

Movies.title: Snowblind
Movies.description: Hugh Garth hides from the law in the frozen Canadian northwest along with his young brother Pete and Pete's former nurse, Bella, who loves Hugh unrequitedly.

Movies.title: Wife Against Wife
Movies.description: Gabrielle Gautier (Starke) falls in love with artist Stannard Dole (Marmont), who is in Paris on vacation.

Movies.title: Flower of the North
Movies.description: Whittemore arrives first and D'Arcambal refuses to meet with him until he saves his daughter, Jeanne (Pauline Starke) from going over the rapids. Then Thorpe arrives and tries to use force by kidnapping Jeanne and insisting that he is her father.

Movies.title: The Wampas Baby Stars of 1922
Movies.description: The WAMPAS Baby Stars was a promotional campaign sponsored by the United States Western Association of Motion Picture Advertisers, which honored 13 (15 in 1932) young actresses �

Movies.title: My Wild Irish Rose
Movies.description: Conn the Shaughraun comes to his rescue, helps him to escape from the prison ship and return to Ireland where he is united with his sweetheart.

Movies.title: The Kingdom Within
Movies.description: Silent film directed by Victor Schertzinger

Movies.title: Lost and Found on a South Sea Island
Movies.description: Faulke, a swindling white trader who persuaded Madge to leave Captain Blackbird, insists that her daughter, Lorna, marry Waki, a native leader, although Lorna loves Lloyd Warren.

Movies.title: Little Church Around the Corner
Movies.description: A wealthy minister in a mining town is something of an advocate for the miners' safety, but he doesn't really get involved in the issue.

Movies.title: The Little Girl Next Door
